content.description: Start matched in the jug on the arete... break right instead of following the arete. Climb up the face, trending right, avoiding holds on the arete, finish on the mega jug and drop off!

Contrived Problem 

  Start at the very left side of the cave, using heelhooks as you trend right. 

  Unwind and swing into jugs. Finish on the obvious finishing jug.
content.location: Lefmost route in Cave. As soon as you enter

content.description: Starts with the start hold of Campus Card II, and the crimp just above it. Head left into a thin crimp rail, then make a big move to a crimp out left, working toward the aréte. More of a side out than a top out.
content.location: In between Unassisted Helicopter and Campus Card II

content.description: Sit start under the roof on a crimper flake and more out more crimps to jugs at the lip
content.location: Right side of Fred's Cave before rounding the corner to the vertical wall

content.description:
Hardest route in the cave! 

  Involving the three hardest problems. 

  Sit start for "Fred's roof" and traverse left to "Chunk up the Deuce".
Start on incut sloper and work out a few moves where the "one inch" crux pinch lies.   A hard leftward dyno gets you to the drop off jug.
content.location: To the right of "Chunk up the Duece"

content.description: Sit Start in the low juggy break down and left from the start of Campus Card II / Not While Driving.Pick your ass up and reach out around the little mini roof to get into the start of Not Whiand finish per that problem.The crux is not dabbing when you are doing the first move. I found a left hand index lock in the jug seam helped tremendously with the first move***the stand start to Not While Driving doesn’t use any of the holds on Campus Card II other than the first rail above the broken OG start hold (and the undercling out right), but transitioning from this Sit Start into the Stand necessitates the use of the the other crimp rail just up and left of the first rail (the right hand start rail of Triforce), but other than that none of the holds on Campus Card II are on***
content.location: Down and left from the start of Campus Card II / Not While Driving.Obvious low juggy break under the little mini roof bulge

content.description: Just as the pre-break version of Not While Driving started the same as Campus Card II, so to should the post-break version. Start matched on the first chalked rail above the now broken OG start hold  From that start rail, cut immediately right on independent holds from Campus Card II (undercling to the right is crucial) and finish on Buddy
content.location: Near left end of the wall, matched on crimp rail just above broken OG start hold.

content.description: Start on good holds at the lip of the roof as for Bio Inflation and move up right to two pockets and then lunge for a jug and drop off.

This endlessly classic problem in Fred's Cave requires power, precision, and maybe even some endurance. Fred's Roof is the most aesthetic and obvious line in the cave. There are small adjustments between, but it is essentially 3 big moves. Start seated, and begin throwing up slightly to the left, and then straight to the huge jug just below the roof. The crux is the middle throw, and is a technical and powerful move from good holds to huge holds.    Hold it together for the last throw. The feet are easy to slip off of when setting up for the giant move.
content.protection: 3 good sized pads and a rug/slider completely covers the landing area. But it's very flat.
content.location: Right side of the main steep section of Fred's Cave. Essentially, to the right of this, there is nothing for a ways until you hit Blogger (at least, I don't think there are any problems between).

content.description: Climb the dirty, neglected, tan streak to the obvious jug and drop off
content.location: Just as you move out of the cave to the vertical wall.  Just right of a large tree

content.description:
Dave Graham Testpiece! 

  Start on rail matched, making desperate hard moves out to the crux involving moves straight out with a sidepull and tiny undercling.  

  Traverse good holds left to a good jug at the beginning of the roof.

Sit Start in the low juggy break down and left from the start of Campus Card II.Pick your ass up and reach out around the little mini roof to get into the start of Campus Card II and finish per that problem.The crux is not dabbing when you are doing the first move. I found a left hand index lock in the jug seam helped tremendously with the first move
content.location: Down and left from the start of Campus Card II.Obvious low juggy break under the little mini roof bulge.

content.description: Sit start at the back on a triangular crimp and climb out the roof to a jug near the lip***The starting triangle hold on this problem has broken off, making the old start impossible. The new start is one hold higher (basically the lowest chalked crimp rail).
content.location: Left side of Fred's Cave.  One of the first problem in the cave. Right of Unassisted Helicopter.  Obvious rock scar where the start hold used to be.

content.description: Direct start to "Chunk up the Deuce"Begin arms wide in compression with an obvious right handed sidepull and bad left pinch a few feet away to the left. Move up into "Chunk up the Dueces" finish.
content.location: Just to the right of Campus Card II

content.description:
A wierd route with one cool move. 

  Try not to dab your ass on this one. 

  Start in a thin slot and make a big move to a crimp. A creative heel hook will help gain access to the jugs above.
content.location: A few feet to the right of "Freds roof"

content.description: Start on good holds at the lip of the roof and move up and left on jugs to the topout, which is usually wet
This are includes Fred's Cave and The Old Style Wall.  None of the climbing is in the sun until late afternoon.
